conclusion: Acceleration from 0 to 10 seconds is +2 m/s²
Acceleration from 10 to 30 seconds is +0.5 m/s²
Acceleration from 30 to 60 seconds is -0.5 m/s²
Integrate acceleration to get velocity and then integrate velocity to obtain distance
Velocity at the end of 0-10 seconds is 20 m/s
Distance traveled in 0-10 seconds is 100 meters
Velocity at the end of 10-30 seconds is 30 m/s
Average velocity during 10-30 seconds is 25 m/s
Distance traveled in 10-30 seconds is 500 meters
Velocity at the end of 30-60 seconds is 15 m/s
Average velocity during 30-60 seconds is 22.5 m/s
Distance traveled in 30-60 seconds is 675 meters
Total distance traveled in 0-60 seconds is 1275 meters
